results.title: Jewellery through 7000 years (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Pieces from Ancient Egypt, China, Sumeria, Greece, Celtic Europe and Byzantium, and examples of the Gothic Renaissance, Elizabethan and Art Nouveau styles are shown. Old techniques for working gold are demonstrated. Also refers to the superstitious, mythological, cultural and religious influences on jewellery design and usage.

results.title: Jerusalem: the Holy City
results.creator_credit: E Keller, F Keller and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Concentrating on the historic settings and contemporary shrines of the respective religions, this film develops the theme of Jerusalem as a city sacred to the Jewish, Christian and Islamic faiths. Settings and structures rich in historic association are shown.

results.title: Jenny is a good thing (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Joan Horvath and United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare
results.brief_description: Documentary on the food and nutrition-related activities which are part of the Head Start program for disadvantaged children in the United States. Children are shown learning about food and its preparation by actively involving themselves in tasks to do with food. Narrated by Burt Lancaster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Horvath and United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare

results.title: Un Jardin public
results.brief_description: In the Square Gambetta in Paris a little boy’s imagination brings a statue to life. There follows a transformation scene and in an imaginary park Marcel Marceau acts out in mime all the habitues of the park - the nursemaids, the young lovers, the policemen, and old men. His impersonations range from the faintly amusing to the maudlin, but Marceau’s many admirers will doubtless enjoy this film.

results.title: Japan: season by season
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Spring comes to Japan. The school year starts in April with special ceremonies in every school, kindergarten and university. The educational system is the driving force behind the speedy modernisation and great industrial development of the country. The rainy season heralds summer which is the sporting and shopping season, and of the great Buddhist Festival. Autumn, as well as being harvest season, brings typhoons and chrysanthemums, and autumnal foliage across the land. Most of Japan experiences a mild winter; modern heating and food preservation make thia a “good” season in a barren time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Sakura Motion Pictures

results.title: Japan newly discovered
results.creator_credit: Dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Japan has been influenced by many countries, and today alternate layers of traditional and foreign cultures appear like the rings of a tree. We see this pattern in the ageless architectural beauty of the Shinto and Buddhist shrines and temples, and the later Christian churches; in the ancient castles, palaces and homes contrasting with the modern concrete and steel skyscrapers; and in the arts and crafts - the tea ceremony, formal gardens, pottery and embroidery.

results.title: Japan in winter
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Winter in Japan is a busy time of year with preparations for the celbration of the New Year. Colorful festivals take place, and the countryside, always of great beauty, is enhanced by snow.

results.title: Janus
results.creator_credit: Anthony Wilkinson, Michael Birkett and James Garrett and Partners
results.brief_description: This film was made for the European Architectural Heritage Year and has no spoken commentary. It considers the character of the European heritage, its neglect through indifference and its destruction through vandalism throughout the ages.
